segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, and it’s making me feel sick.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing in the puddle, and it’s just gross.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so careless, and it’s making me uncomfortable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s stool is filthy, and he’s about to fall into the wet mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so messy, and I can’t stand it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and it’s just getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely oblivious, and it’s frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children don’t seem to care about the mess they’re making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is one of the most unpleasant scenes I’ve ever witnessed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the tidy garden and the messy kitchen is jarring.
segments.speaker: PAR
